title: Specific Heat - Density of Oil from Temp Change

content.question: A sample of oil has a specific heat <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>c</mi></math> and volume <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>V</mi></math>. The oil is initially at room temperature. An amount <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math> of thermal energy is added to the oil, raising the temperature of the oil sample by an amount <math alttext="delta T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>T</mi></mstyle></math>, which is still below the boiling point of the oil. Which of the following expressions is equal to the density of the oil?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator Q, and denominator V times c delta T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi>V</mi><mi>c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator V times Q, and denominator c delta T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>V</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator Q, and denominator c delta T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator V times c delta T, and denominator Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>V</mi><mi>c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow><mi>Q</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator Q, and denominator V times c delta T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>Q</mi><mrow><mi>V</mi><mi>c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
